definition: wishing to do one's work or duty well and thoroughly
examples: a conscientious man, he took his duties very seriously

definition: aggressively greedy or grasping
examples: rapacious landlords

definition: go back on a promise, undertaking, or contract
examples: the government had reneged on its election promises

definition: well chosen or suited to the circumstances
examples: a felicitous phrase

definition: showing contempt; scornful
examples: she was intolerant and contemptuous of the majority of the human race

definition: leave the main subject temporarily in speech or writing
examples: I have digressed a little from my original plan

definition: recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources
examples: profligate consumers of energy

definition: a licentious, dissolute person
examples: he is a drunkard and a profligate

definition: given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behaviour
examples: a capricious and often brutal administration

definition: unimportant or trivial
examples: a trifling sum

definition: showing great care and perseverance
examples: she was assiduous in pointing out every feature

definition: (of a person) fond of company; sociable
examples: he was a popular and gregarious man

definition: well meaning and kindly
examples: a benevolent smile
he was something of a benevolent despot

definition: (of speech or writing) using or containing too many words; tediously lengthy
examples: he found the narrative too prolix and discursive

definition: spread (something, especially information) widely
examples: health authorities should foster good practice by disseminating information

definition: merciless; severe
examples: he is unsparing in his criticism of the arms trade

definition: public shame or disgrace
examples: the ignominy of being imprisoned

definition: causing harm or damage
examples: divorce is assumed to have deleterious effects on children

definition: not friendly or forthcoming; cool and distant
examples: they were courteous but faintly aloof
an aloof and somewhat austere figure

definition: the action of attacking or assertively rejecting cherished beliefs and institutions or established values and practices.
arrogant and domineering
examples: his imperious demands

definition: relevant or applicable to a particular matter; apposite
examples: she asked me a lot of very pertinent questions
practitioners must consider all factors pertinent to a situation

definition: of or involving strongly critical or disputatious writing or speech
examples: a polemical essay

definition: eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant
examples: the truculent attitude of farmers to cheaper imports

definition: having or using the style or diction of prose as opposed to poetry; lacking imaginativeness or originality
examples: prosaic language can't convey the experience

definition: digressing from subject to subject
examples: students often write dull, second-hand, discursive prose

definition: very complicated or detailed
examples: an intricate network of canals

definition: A didactic person; specifically a teacher or instructor, especially considered as patronizing or tediously pedantic.
the quality of talking fluently, readily, or incessantly; talkativeness
examples: her legendary volubility deserted her

definition: very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail
examples: she dressed with fastidious care

definition: disgust or sicken (someone) with an excess of sweetness, richness, or sentiment
examples: the first sip gives a malty taste that never cloys
a romantic, rather cloying story

definition: making great demands on one's skill, attention, or other resources
examples: the exacting standards laid down by the organic food industry

definition: not having any serious purpose or value
examples: frivolous ribbons and lacy frills
rules to stop frivolous lawsuits

definition: bad-tempered and sulky
examples: a sullen pout

definition: a sulky or depressed mood.
relating to or situated on the edge or periphery of something
examples: the peripheral areas of Europe

definition: a peripheral device
examples: printers and other peripherals

definition: occurring at a favourable time; opportune
examples: his appearance had seemed more than just providential

definition: (of a person or process) careful, thorough, and extremely attentive to details
examples: the research has been carried out with scrupulous attention to detail

definition: having an obstinately uncooperative attitude towards authority or discipline
examples: a class of recalcitrant fifteen-year-olds

definition: a person with an obstinately uncooperative attitude
examples: a stiff-necked recalcitrant and troublemaker

definition: lacking flavour; weak or tasteless
examples: mugs of insipid coffee

definition: directly opposed or contrasted; mutually incompatible
examples: people whose religious beliefs are antithetical to mine

definition: restrict (something) within limits
examples: the minister's powers are circumscribed both by tradition and the organization of local government

definition: (especially of a comment or style of speaking) sharp and forthright
examples: his acerbic wit

definition: opposed to liberal principles; restricting freedom of thought or behaviour
examples: illiberal and anti-democratic policies

definition: the quality of being affable; geniality
examples: an air of benign affability

definition: making an uproar or loud, confused noise
examples: tumultuous applause

definition: (of a person) unable to remain still, silent, or submissive, especially because of boredom or dissatisfaction
examples: the crowd had been waiting for hours and many were becoming restive
he reiterated his determination to hold the restive republics together

definition: a person walking rather than travelling in a vehicle
examples: a pedestrian bridge
the road is so dangerous pedestrians avoid it

definition: lacking inspiration or excitement; dull
examples: disenchantment with their pedestrian lives

definition: (of an appearance) fail to give a true impression of (something)
examples: his lively, alert manner belied his years

definition: abstinence from alcoholic drink
examples: the temperance movement

definition: involving or limited to basic principles
examples: he received a rudimentary education

definition: the movement of the tide out to sea
examples: the tide was on the ebb
the ebb tide

definition: (of tidewater) move away from the land; recede
examples: the tide began to ebb

definition: in the language of ordinary or familiar conversation; informally
examples: the storms hit several states along a corridor colloquially referred to as ‘tornado alley’

definition: great respect; reverence
examples: the traditional veneration of saints

definition: (of the moon) have a progressively smaller part of its visible surface illuminated, so that it appears to decrease in size.
the amount by which a plank or log is bevelled or falls short of a squared shape
examples: I cut the log into slabs without removing the outside wane

definition: reject (someone or something) in an abrupt or ungracious manner
examples: I asked her to be my wife, and was rebuffed in no uncertain terms

definition: an abrupt or ungracious rejection of an offer, request, or friendly gesture
examples: his reserve was not intended as a rebuff
callers phoning a chatline need have no fear of rebuff

definition: (of a fruit or plant) containing much pith.
not in harmony or keeping with the surroundings or other aspects of something
examples: the duffel coat looked incongruous with the black dress she wore underneath

definition: not the same; different
examples: a collection of dissimilar nations lacking overall homogeneity
the pleasures of the romance novel are not dissimilar from those of the chocolate bar

definition: recklessly bold or rash
examples: it would be foolhardy to go into the scheme without support

definition: not resulting from or achieved through deliberate planning
examples: he was pardoned for inadvertent manslaughter
an inadvertent administrative error occurred that resulted in an overpayment

definition: boast about or praise (something), especially excessively
examples: the much vaunted information superhighway

definition: a boast.
make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better
examples: the reform did much to ameliorate living standards

definition: having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage
examples: an astute businessman

definition: (of two things) able to be interchanged
examples: the V8 engines are all interchangeable with each other
eyepieces are interchangeable and one can use any eyepiece with any telescope

definition: find (something) out for certain; make sure of
examples: management should ascertain whether adequate funding can be provided
an attempt to ascertain the cause of the accident

definition: elaborately or highly decorated
examples: an ornate wrought-iron railing

definition: a descendant or the descendants of a person, animal, or plant; offspring
examples: shorthorn cattle are highly effective in bestowing their characteristics on their progeny

definition: not influenced by strong emotion, and so able to be rational and impartial
examples: she dealt with life's disasters in a calm, dispassionate way

definition: abundant in supply or quantity
examples: she took copious notes

definition: witheringly scornful; severely critical
examples: she launched a scathing attack on the Prime Minister

definition: feel bitterness or indignation at (a circumstance, action, or person)
examples: she resented the fact that I had children

definition: suggest or assume the existence, fact, or truth of (something) as a basis for reasoning, discussion, or belief
examples: she postulated that the environmentalists might have a case
his theory postulated a rotatory movement for hurricanes

definition: a thing suggested or assumed as true as the basis for reasoning, discussion, or belief
examples: perhaps the postulate of Babylonian influence on Greek astronomy is incorrect

definition: not in keeping with good taste and propriety; improper
examples: a pub crawl with sundry indecorous adventures

definition: showy but cheap and of poor quality
examples: tawdry jewellery

definition: cheap and gaudy finery.
of or forming a general summary or synopsis
examples: a synoptic outline of the contents

definition: the Synoptic Gospels.
very unwilling to spend money or use resources
examples: even the parsimonious Joe paid for drinks all round

definition: poor; needy
examples: a charity for the relief of indigent artists

definition: a needy person.

synonyms: without a penny to one's name
without two farthings to rub together
without two pennies to rub together

definition: a deep or considered thought about something
examples: philosophical ruminations about life and humanity

definition: translucently clear
examples: mountains reflected in the pellucid waters

definition: sternness or severity of manner or attitude
examples: he was noted for his austerity and his authoritarianism

definition: agree to a demand, request, or treaty
examples: the authorities did not accede to the strikers' demands

definition: acting or done quickly and without thought or care
examples: she might live to rue this impetuous decision

definition: showing very poor judgement; unwise
examples: I took a few injudicious swigs of potent cider

definition: capturing and holding one's attention; fascinating
examples: an enthralling best-seller

definition: hard to control or deal with
examples: intractable economic problems

definition: inducing feelings of anxiety or worry
examples: he found Jean's gaze disquieting

definition: severe or strict in manner or attitude
examples: he was an austere man, with a rigidly puritanical outlook

definition: annoyingly insensitive or slow to understand
examples: he wondered if the doctor was being deliberately obtuse

definition: having a red or flushed complexion
examples: a stout man with a florid face

definition: optimistic or positive, especially in an apparently bad or difficult situation
examples: he is sanguine about prospects for the global economy
the committee takes a more sanguine view

definition: a blood-red colour.

synonyms: disposed to look on the bright side

definition: grant (a title, degree, benefit, or right)
examples: the Minister may have exceeded the powers conferred on him by Parliament

definition: holding firmly to an opinion or a course of action
examples: he worked with a pertinacious resistance to interruptions

definition: unusually or disproportionately large; excessive
examples: the case had taken up an inordinate amount of time

definition: a person who is abnormally anxious about their health.
done or shown openly; plainly apparent
examples: in untreated cases, overt psychosis may occur
an overt act of aggression

definition: having or displaying a passionate intensity
examples: a fervent supporter of the revolution

definition: (of a person) reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little
examples: after such gatherings she would be taciturn and morose

definition: fame or acknowledged superiority within a particular sphere
examples: her eminence in cinematography

definition: lack of seriousness; light-heartedness
examples: a night of fun and frivolity
they concerned themselves almost entirely with frivolities

definition: relating to or expressing penitence or penance
examples: penitential tears

definition: waver between different opinions or actions; be indecisive
examples: I vacillated between teaching and journalism

definition: having or showing too great a readiness to believe things
examples: a ceremony staged for credulous tourists

definition: not easily upset or excited
examples: a placid, contented man

definition: publicly denounce
examples: they decried human rights abuses

definition: sparing in the use of words; abrupt
examples: a terse statement

definition: over-imaginative and unrealistic
examples: ever more fanciful proposals were raised

definition: (of an animal, especially a horse) nervous or excitable; easily scared
examples: a skittish chestnut mare
skittish investors withdrew their money from equity markets

definition: spending money or using resources freely and recklessly; wastefully extravagant
examples: prodigal habits die hard

definition: a person who spends money in a recklessly extravagant way
examples: the government wished to clip the wings of the local authority prodigals

definition: relating to or characterized by government by the wealthy
examples: his plutocratic, anti-democratic regime
a state run by a plutocratic elite

definition: expressing or characterized by vehement opinions; loud and forceful
examples: he was a vociferous opponent of the takeover

definition: believing in or practising religious heresy
examples: heretical beliefs
a heretical theologian

definition: (of a phrase or idea) having been overused; unoriginal and trite
examples: hackneyed old sayings

definition: modesty or shyness resulting from a lack of self-confidence
examples: I say this with some diffidence

definition: the quality or fact of being able to grip something firmly; grip
examples: the sheer tenacity of the limpet
